japanese: ５年後――
translation: Five years later%p-2;――

japanese: いらっしゃ――
translation: Welcome%p-2;――

japanese: って、あんたたちか。
translation: Oh, it's you guys.

japanese: 一花、久しぶり。
translation: It's been a while, Ichika.

japanese:
待ってたよー！
アメリカからお帰りなさーい！
translation:
We've been waiting for you!
Welcome back to Japan!

japanese:
久しぶり！
３人とも元気そうでよかった――
translation:
Long time no see!
You three look good, that's great%p-2;――

japanese:
うん、よかったんだけどさ。
お店、今日も開けてるんだ？
結婚式当日なのに。
translation:
Yeah, it's good, but hey,
is the shop open today?
It's the day of the wedding after all.

japanese:
だよね、私も来てビックリした。
二乃、止めなかったの？
translation:
Yeah, I was surprised when I showed up.
You couldn't stop her, Nino?

japanese:
止めたわよ。
でも、いつも通りにしてたいって言い張って。
translation:
I did.
However, she insisted on doing things as usual.

japanese:
なにもしてないと、余計なことを考えちゃうんだ。
ここに立ってるほうが落ち着く。
translation:
If I don't do anything,
I'll start thinking about unnecessary things.
Standing here makes me feel calm.

japanese:
それに、今日も常連さんが来るかもしれないから。
お店が閉まってたらガッカリさせちゃう。
translation:
Besides, there might be regulars coming today.
If the shop was closed, they would be disappointed.

japanese:
だから、今日くらい問題ないでしょ。
そもそも結婚式だって事前に言ってあるわけだし。
translation:
Oh c'mon, it wouldn't be a problem today, right?
Besides, we've already said we're having a wedding
in advance.

japanese:
あ、じゃあ、もしかして、
そこに飾ってあるお花はお客さんからの結婚祝い？
translation:
Oh, then maybe the flowers there
are wedding gifts from customers?

japanese: あっちのお花も？
translation: The flowers over there, too?

japanese: うん、そうなんだ。
translation: Yes, that's right.

japanese:
最近は常連さんも増えてきて。
遠慮したんだけど、是非って。
translation:
Recently, we've been getting more regulars.
I refused the flowers at first, but they kept insisting.

japanese: お客さんにお祝いしてもらえるなんて、素敵だね。
translation:
It feels wonderful to receive wedding wishes
from customers, doesn't it?

japanese:
……すごく嬉しい。
応援してくれる人たちのためにも、
お店、頑張らないと。
translation:
...I'm really happy.
To show our appreciation for the people 
who support us, we have to work hard at the shop.

japanese:
そーね、頑張ってもらわないと困るわ。
近頃じゃ、三玖の味が好きだって
ご指名で注文する人もいるくらいだし。
translation:
That's right, we need you to do your best. 
More customers are coming to the shop that
love your pastries and want to try your food, Miku.

japanese:
へえー！
そこまでファンがついてるってすごくない？
translation: Wow! Isn't it amazing to have fans like that?

japanese: 二乃～、このままじゃ弟子に越えられちゃうよ？
translation:
Nino, if you're not careful,
your disciple might surpass you, you know?

japanese:
別にいいわよ？
うちの売り上げであることには変わりないもの。
translation:
I don't really mind, you know?
It still contributes to our sales.

japanese: もー、素直じゃないなー。
translation: Oh my, you're not being honest at all.

japanese:
三玖も成長したんだね。
石コロッケを作ってた頃が懐かしいよ。
translation:
Miku has matured a lot.
I miss the time when she made stone croquettes.

japanese: もう、いつの話？
translation: Come on. When was that?

japanese:
三玖には二乃っていう先生がいるんだもん。
教え方も上手だし。
translation:
Miku has a teacher named Nino.
In fact, she's good at teaching, too.

japanese:
あら、本物の先生であるあんたに
そう言ってもらえるなんて、光栄だわ。
translation:
Well, it's an honor
to be praised by a real teacher like you.

japanese:
でも結局は、三玖がずっと頑張ってきたからよ。
不器用で味音痴のダブルパンチを
乗り越えたんだから。
translation:
But in the end, it's because Miku
has been working very hard.
She overcame her clumsiness and acquired a sense of taste.

japanese: ……ありがと。
translation: ...Thanks.

japanese: うんうん、愛の力は偉大だ！
translation: Yeah, yeah, that is the power of love!

japanese: 愛って……。
translation: Love...

japanese:
だって、上杉さんに美味しいご飯を
食べてもらいたいっていうのが一番の理由だよね？
translation:
Well... The main reason you started your
culinary journey was because
you want Uesugi-san to eat delicious food, right?

japanese: そうだけど……。
translation: That's true, but...

japanese: だったら、なかのは安泰だ。
translation: In that case, 'NAKANO' is safe for now.

japanese:
ううん、まだまだだから。
いまよりもっと美味しい料理を作るつもり。
translation:
No, we're not quite there yet.
I'm planning to make
even more delicious dishes than now.

japanese: お、気合い入ってるね。
translation: Oh, you're fired up, huh?

japanese:
昔、ここでやってたお店の人気メニューは、
手作りパンだったんだって。
translation:
I've heard that the popular item menu at the store
that was here before was homemade bread.

japanese:
私もそういう、お店の看板って言えるくらいの
メニューを作り上げたい。
translation:
I also want to create a store's signature dish,
something similar to that.

japanese: どんな料理にするのか決めてるの？
translation: Have you decided what kind of dish to make?

japanese:
まだなんだけど、試作品は色々と作ってる。
風太郎にも何度も味見してもらって。
translation:
Not yet, but I've been making various trial products
and having Futaro taste them multiple times.

japanese: ふーん？
translation: Hmmm?

japanese: なるほど。
translation: I see.

japanese: ん？　なに？
translation: Hm? What?

japanese: 何度も味見、かあ。
translation: Having him taste them multiple times, huh?

japanese:
そういうことなのよ。
もう２人の共同作業は進行中なわけ。
translation:
That's what it is.
They're already working together as a team of two.

japanese:
も、もう。
からかわないで。
translation:
O-oh, c'mon.
Don't tease me like that.

japanese: 看板メニュー、楽しみにしてるね。
translation: I'm looking forward to the signature dish.

japanese: うん。
translation: Okay.

japanese:
あ、そうそう。
例の件なんだけど、
私の担当メイクさん、来てくれるって。
translation:
Oh yeah.
Speaking of which, regarding that matter,
my makeup artist will come.

japanese: じゃ、本当にやるんだ。
translation: So, you're really going to do it.

japanese: うん、上杉君には確かめておかないと。
translation: Yes. We'll have to have Uesugi-kun confirm it.

japanese: それじゃ、あれも済ませておきましょ。
translation: Well, let's take care of that then.

japanese: オッケー。
translation: Okay.

japanese: 私が預かってたほうは、結局しまったままだったわ。
translation: The one I had was still stored away.

japanese: これが私たちからの結婚祝い。
translation: This is our wedding gift to you, Miku.

japanese: お母さんの、形見のピアス。
translation: It's Mom's heirloom earrings.

japanese:
式場に着いたら慌ただしくなっちゃうだろうし、
いまここで開けたほうがいいよね。
translation:
When we get to the venue,
things'll get chaotic,
so we should pierce your ears there.

japanese: 開けるって、ピアスホール？
translation: Pierce her ears, huh?

japanese:
他にないでしょ。
ピアッサーも持ってきてるし。
translation:
There's no other option, is there?
I brought a piercer too.

japanese: 三玖、いいのよね？
translation: Is it okay with you, Miku?

japanese:
うん。
結婚式では、これをつけるつもりだったから。
translation:
Yes.
I was planning to wear them for the wedding anyway.

japanese:
初めて開けるんだよね？
大丈夫？
translation: Is this your first time getting pierced? Are you okay?

japanese:
正直怖いけど、みんなが見ててくれるなら。
覚悟も決めて来た。
translation:
To be honest, I'm a bit anxious,
but with everybody's support I should be fine.

japanese:
いいわ。
その言葉、忘れるんじゃないわよ。
translation: That's good. Don't forget those words.

japanese:
覚悟に応えて、こちらも心を込めて
開けさせていただきます。
translation:
In response to your determination,
we will also pierce your ears with all our hearts.

japanese:
あ、あの？
なんだか２人とも……。
translation:
U-um?
Both of you seem...

japanese: 大丈夫、痛いのは一瞬だから。
translation: It's okay, the pain is only temporary.

japanese:
ええと……。
みんな祝福してくれてるんだよね？
translation:
Well...
Is everyone gonna bless me?

japanese:
もちろん。
私たちの気持ち、しっかり受け取って？
translation:
Of course.
Please receive our gratitude, okay?

japanese: 違う感情が込められてる気がするんだけど……。
translation:
I feel like
there's a different emotion behind that...

japanese: 今日のこと、忘れられない思い出にしようね！
translation: Let's make today an unforgettable memory!

japanese:
ご、ごめん！
やっぱり心の準備を――
translation: S-sorry! Give me time to mentally prepare myself%p-2;――

japanese:
四葉。
ちょっと押さえてなさい。
translation:
Yotsuba.
Hold her down a little.

japanese: はーい。
translation: Okaaay.

japanese: よ、四葉！？
translation: Y-Yotsuba?!

japanese: せーの！
translation: One, two, three!

japanese: 三玖、結婚おめでとう！
translation: Miku, congratulations on getting married!

japanese: きゃー！
translation: EEEP!
